intro: Sphaerocephalus ilicifolius, commonly known as the holly-leaved sphaerocephalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves that resemble those of holly. Its compact growth habit and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires partial to full shade for optimal growth.
